problem: Problem: I hate my job but I am scared to quit and seek a new career.
solution: Solution: Hello, what would you like to talk about? What makes your job stressful for you? Do you help your clients to make it to a better financial situation? But you offer them a better future than what they have currently. It may not be what they wanted, but it helps them in the long run. I can understand that.  Is there another job that would pay you close to what you currently make? Is it possible to reframe how you look at your clients' dire financial situations? Some people can't do what you do because they don't have the heart to give someone else bad news. The reality is though, someone needs to fill that role and you do help people I've had to deal with collections before when I was in  bad financial condition. The person on the other line was really helpful though. She was understanding, It may not be for you. I think you should think about the pros and cons of keeping your position. It might make things clearer for you.  I wouldn't stay if it really impacts your mental health in a negative way. Still, you may need to zoom out and see the bigger picture: that you provide a needed service and you do it compassionately No doubt, but you know in your heart what is right for you.  It's no problem. I hope you can make a decision about this situation and then be at peace with it Ok, take care

problem: Problem: I have complete unsupportive friends its to the point where i dont even feel like i have friends any more .
solution: Solution: Hello how are you? I'm doing ok I'm glad you are good. Is it snowing by you? Merry Christmas! How can I help you today? I hear you are having trouble figuring out which friends are really your friends and which ones aren't. Is that about right? I understand that... Did something happen that makes you feel like that? Is this a significant other? Are they ignoring you? Are you sure they are okay? Or not away with family for the holidays? That's no good what do you think the problem is? Do you owe someone already? That can get in the way of a friendship sometimes, but I try not to get ahead of myself and  jump the gun. They may have lost a phone or something may have come up... That very well could be... Are you working? I see, Have you tried for unemployment? I understand that. What if that is the case? You may need to talk to them and let them know how you feel about that. How long has this been going on? I understand that, but if you want to get to a point that you feel better about it then you will have to speak to them. Do you see them everyday? I understand that, are you able to go over there. Well I can see that you have put the effort in to try and keep the relationship so it sounds like the ball is in their court if they want to do the same. Well that is about all that can be done and wait for them to come around...Do you have  any hobbies? I like to go on runs every morning. It helps to clear my mind and makes it easier to brush things off when they bother me. What instrument do you play? It is a really good stress reliever. I played when I  was younger, didn't ever get very good. Did you? Hmm, well maybe take some more lessons, We can always strive to be better at everything we do. Maybe take a run in order to clear your mind. I'm sure they will come around. That may be a good idea. Good talk to them and may find out that it was never anything against you I sometimes get ahead of myself and try to figure out what is going on and thinking that it was something I did. You are right too. COVID has stressed everyone out to the max. It has been a crazy year I am glad that it is almost over. I'm sure it will. Is there anything else I can help you with today? No problem, I hope everything works out for you and your friends. Have a great New Year! Good day!

problem: Problem: I have been out of work for five weeks in quarantine due to testing positive for COVID-19.  I fear that my employer will not take me back to work even once I test negative.
solution: Solution: Hi there, how are you feeling today?  Hi :) Is there anything you'd like to talk about? Something on your mind?  Oh I am so sorry to hear that! Are you at least getting sick pay? If not, are you getting advice about help you might be able to access?  Oh I am so sorry to hear that! Are you at least getting sick pay? If not, are you getting advice about help you might be able to access?  (sorry for duplication, not sure what happened there!) So you have been getting some assistance?  I see, so you are really financially struggling at the moment? Is there anywhere else you could apply for assistance? What about a foodbank?  I hear you there - I spent a long time on hold for an official matter the other day. I guess that everyone is really desperate for help and advice right now.  I hope that they can help you. My partner and I have used one before and they were very helpful. I felt a bit ashamed but there was no judgement at all.  That sounds like a very positive thing to have done. I really hope that they pay some attention to you. This situation is not your fault!  Yes they are run by lovely people. Ours gave us a pamphlet for cheap and easy to make recipes too.  So, at least it sounds like you have a good handle on this and are doing everything you can to help yourself, am I right?  That sounds very encouraging! It's amazing what you can make even with cheap food. Noodles , for instance, are very versatile :)  It's a very strange situation and I suspect that some of the authorities just feel overwhelmed and have no idea how to cope.  That would be incredibly immoral of him. Do you feel that he is likely to do such a  thing?  That is a very rational way to look at things. I really hope that it does not come to thank though! Thank you for talking and I wish you all the best for the coming months. I am glad that you'd not roll over and accept ill treatment! Well done :)  I am afraid I need to leave now but thank you for talking :) (can you press the quit button and take the survey?) Best wishes! You too!

problem: Problem: I am depressed staying home due to COVID
solution: Solution: Hi! How are you doing?  I am okay thanks but it is a worrying year. Have you been worrying about anything?  Ah I hear you, I have been self isolating too. Do you have an online support network?  Well, friends you can talk to during this difficult time? I have a lot of friends on facebook and similar that I can talk to.  Sometimes it does just make it easier to know that other people are in the same situation as you :)  Yes .. or at least share coping mechanisms perhaps?  Do you have any hobbies that you can occupy yourself with right now?  Could you perhaps set up Zoom meetings where you could play together online?  No I don't think so :) I think that it is totally live so you could play just as you would if you were together in person.  I hope it goes well for you. It has been such an awful year, hasn't it?  I wish you all the very best for 2021. I hope that you get to get together with your band again and rock!  Yes, all we need to do is be patient! Have a great New Year and thanks for talking.

problem: Problem: I found out that my boyfriend had been lying to me about his entire life, and so the future that he had said we were building towards was all but impossible. I'm trying to figure out if I should stay with him.
solution:
Solution: Hello, what is life like for you at the moment?  I am sorry to hear that but I am happy to listen and help you if I can what sort of things are you trying to decide?  Well, let's try to take it one problem at a time so's not to get overwhelmed. What is your biggest problem at the moment?  Ah, am I to take it that a relationship has recently ended?  Ah I totally hear you .. the old 'we're getting divorced' line. I've been in that one! You are well out of this.  From personal experience I think that if they say they're going to get divorced and then drag their feet it is never going to happen.  Well, if you were to give him an ultimatum what do you think he would say?  And he's still married?  I can tell that you feel that you are being cheated here. I can't tell you what to do but don't you think you deserve better?  It's not for me to say but I wonder if he's really going to change as he has not already.  How do your children feel about this? And his?  Yes, I can imagine that it is. It is always really difficult when children are involved. I know you would not want your children to be hurt  I hear you. Covid has disrupted the whole world so might this year! I can't wait for it to be over.  But it will hurt them more the longer the situation goes on :(  Well it surely could not be worse :) (sorry was afk let me catch up)
 Is it possible she is suffering from depression?  It just worries me that he might treat you the same way if you were ever in the same position  And how does she feel about you?  I think it would be better if he  were able to come to a sensible financial solution with her. This situation is damaging for everyone.  I hope I have been able to have been of some help to you :) A very happy New Year to you!  You just need to press quit and take the survey - it has to be done at your end :)

problem: Problem: the uncertainty surrounding the corona virus pandemic. the unavailability of jobs. lack of success get jobs applied for. No ease or comfort of end being in sight
solution: Solution: Hi there, how are you doing?  I am sorry to hear that. Would you like to talk about anything specific?  So you're unemployed? I am sorry to hear that. Are you prepared to take jobs that are below your usual level just to get by for a while?  It's a very difficult time to be out of work, I know. I hope that there is something out there for you. Have you tried employment agencies?  Well, on the plus side at least you do have savings .. hopefully this can give you some security for a while  Are your family being supportive of your situation?  Perhaps bankruptcy might not be a bad option? You would be eligible for some help then at least. I sometimes feel I would have been better off if I'd just not bothered working!  Anyway thank you for talking and I really hope things go better for you in the future :)  You're welcome :) You need to press quit first and take the survey before I can :)  hello? :)  Please can you quit and take the survey. I cannot do it till you do and neither of us will get paid if I have to quit. Yes it's been done :)  Please can you quit. I have other things to do and if I have to leave because you did not end this neither of us gets anything. It can only be ended your side.

problem: Problem: I am looking for more online jobs. but it is hard to find.
solution: Solution: Hello, how are you feeling at the moment?  I am not so bad thanks. Is there anything on your mind right now?  I hear you! I do gig work online too but it can be very difficult to find any. I think a lot more people are working online due to the pandemic.  Are you struggling financially at the moment, then?  I have not but I appreciate the recommendation! I think that we all need to come together and help each other at this time.  Are you aware that there are organisations that can offer a little help at this time? Food banks for instance, though I know some people feel awkward about accepting such help.  I have had to use foodbanks once or twice this year and I did feel a bit bad about it but everyone there was very kind and no-one judged us.  There is nothing to be ashamed of in doing so and when you get to a better position you can give back to them.  Do you feel you will be getting the vaccine when it is rolled out where you are?  That is a good idea - yes, I will get it. I think and hope it will help 2021 to be a better year than 2020 has been!  So, you feel that the New Year might be a turning point for us all?  Yes it might take a little while - we are definitely not out of the woods yet and people do need to stick to the regulations to try to mitigate the situation.  I sincerely hope that things pick up for you and for all of us. And that online work remains plentiful :D  Anyway it has been lovely to talk to you, enjoy the rest of your Christmas Day!  (I can't end it from my end, you have to :))  Please? :D

problem: Problem: Not sure how to explain that I want out of marriage

I know from experience that our self esteem suffers when we're in an unhappy marriage. It takes a lot of courage to seek help so I applaud you! I'm glad I could help and I wish you the best of luck!

problem: Problem: I had a huge fight with my girlfriend and she left me.  She accused me of neglecting her even though I needed to spend time with my family and spent as much time with her as I could.
solution: Solution: . If you want to fix things, try giving her some space and then reach out with an open, honest conversation—acknowledging her feelings while also explaining your side calmly. If she’s willing to talk, focus on understanding rather than defending yourself. If she isn't, it might be best to accept her decision, reflect on the situation, and prioritize your own healing. problem: Problem: Not being able to see family and friends due to Covid.
solution: Solution: Feeling isolated due to Covid can be tough, but staying connected in different ways can help. Try video calls, virtual game nights, or online watch parties to stay in touch with family and friends. Use this time to pick up new hobbies, focus on self-care, or engage in activities like reading, exercising, or journaling. If restrictions allow, consider safe outdoor meetups or socially distanced visits. Remember, this situation is temporary, and prioritizing health now will help ensure better times ahead. Stay strong!

problem: Problem: My ex partner is harassing me and will not stop talking to my friends and family.
solution: Solution: If your ex-partner is harassing you and contacting your friends and family, set clear boundaries by blocking them on all platforms and informing your loved ones not to engage. Document any harassment, including messages and interactions, as evidence. If the behavior continues, consider filing for a restraining order or a no-contact order through legal authorities. You can also report harassment to social media platforms and seek support from local law enforcement or a lawyer if necessary. Prioritize your safety and well-being, and don’t hesitate to reach out to a trusted friend or counselor for emotional support.

problem: Problem: breakup with partner
solution: Solution: Hey there! How are you feeling today? Is something troubling you? I'm sorry to hear that. I know how bad it can feel when life throws you a curve-ball. Can you tell me about your situation? Oh dear. That is a very upsetting situation. It sounds like you might be feeling lonely and rejected as a result of your girlfriend breaking up with you. Is that right? That's a long time. I was in a similar situation not too long ago and I understand how hard this must be for you. During a time like this, some people find it helpful to keep busy doing some kind of activity to take their mind off of their pain. Is there something you can do to take your mind off of it until you're ready to manage your feelings? Okay, that's very understandable. I'm sure there's another strategy we can come up with. Do you have a friend or family member you can talk about your feelings with? That's great. You've already taken a huge step by reaching out for help and that's a big deal! A good next step might be letting the people around you know that you need some support at this time. Sometimes people don't know something until you tell them, even if it seems obvious. Is that something you can do? Okay, I understand. Do you feel embarrassed because this is happening to you? I understand that your feelings of sadness run very deep. Do you have people in your life who you can safely spend time with without necessarily talking about your feelings? Feeling connected to people can help quite a lot. It's great that you have someone who can give you positivity and support. Do you feel comfortable with trying that or would you like to explore other options? It might be helpful to simply spend some time together. Connecting with someone who cares about you can help reassure your positive feelings in yourself. If you feel able to, something outdoors might be good. Fresh air and physical activity can help lower anxiety and doing a mutual activity can help strengthen bonds between people. Yes, that's a great idea! It sounds like you're already better at this than you think. Fantastic. I hope this strategy works for you and helps you feel better. Exactly! You don't have to do anything that you're not comfortable with. Feeling strong is very empowering but it's okay to feel vulnerable sometimes too. There are no wrong answers here. Perhaps once you find a new job your disappointment with the last one won't be so disappointing anymore. If the new job is better you wouldn't have found it working the last job. problem: Problem: My best friend finally stopped showing up and stopped replying to my message.
solution:

 Hello! How can I encourage you today?
 Sorry that posted twice! :o You are growing apart from your best friend? Is this a good thing or not a good thing? Or you aren't sure?
 Ouch! That is a sad thing. As I was sitting here thinking about friends I have moved on from, sadly, most of the time it was for the best, even though it hurt at the time.
 Life is a journey, and as we walk toward goals in our life, people either join us or bring us down.  Sometimes they only walk on the path we are on for a short time, sometimes longer.  I have learned in life that unhealthy people run from problems, healthy people stick in the mud with you and try to work out issues.  Have you other friends? Yes, and as you grow and mature, your life goals change, not everyone will travel with you. Right now you are starting out, I'm in the retired stage, lol Now I'm interested in helping younger people. It's amazing how our priorities change.  I've basically figured out life only makes sense with God, and I don't worry about a thing now, very little upsets or angers me, it truly isn't worth it.  A LOT of people have no goals. I think this is actually a good time to examine the year, what you did right, what you didn't do so right, and where you want to go next year.  I think self reflection is good for us.  A young neighbor just stopped by today, and he just moved out of his home, he is consumed with HOW do I pay the electric, HOW do I budget? How do I cook?  lol Like it is so interesting to see the journey in life. And my faith in Jesus Christ is really the most important thing.  Do pray for your friend, and I will say a prayer too. Maybe he will come around some day?
 I had two brothers die from alcohol and drugs. I had to learn not to enable them. Sadly, people choose their own life. There is opportunity to get sober, my husband is a recovered alcoholic.  When hanging with them and they do not want to change, sometimes the best thing to do is to walk away and let them hit bottom.  I have 2 brothers that DID find recover and a sister too. Does your school have any counsellors offering help for free? Many do.  I believe that there are some charities that will offer a certain number of free therapy sessions too  Yes I think so though I am not totally sure. There should be someone at your school, online or not, who can advise you.  Really though I think that your problem is self esteem .. you should think better of yourself :) I can tell that you set yourself a very high standard but I also think that you need to be kind to yourself.  I can understand that - this has been happening to me all of my life. Have you tried to take anything to help?  I can recommend a hot milky drink before bed and perhaps a hot water bottle. Anyway I hope that I have been able to be of some assistance to you!  Have a lovely holiday season.  And you :) remember to hit the quit button and take the survey ;)

problem: Problem: I miss my girlfriend, I feel I have no one in my life.

Have you considered seeing a third party to help you both talk this out?  I seem, so do I hear you saying that you feel that everyone is against you on this and that you feel powerless? Please know that you are not alone in this situation and that there will be light at the end of the tunnel. You might be better off without her  That is a good way to think! Never let something like this destroy your self esteem.  Yes, I am engaged now. I realise that my ex did me the biggest favour anyone ever could!  Maybe you should think about talking to a counsellor or something about this, just to work through your feelings?  You are most welcome. I have a few minutes left to talk if there's anything else on your mind?  How is life treating you otherwise?

problem: Problem: I have a ton of tests and projects all due very soon and it is during a time in which I had not seen any friends and am feeling down. I feel very overwhelmed and sad.
solution:
Solution: Hello there! How can I encourage you today?
 So you have had a lot of stress with school lately and are struggling to keep yourself cheerful? Is there something in particular at school that is stressing you out? Exams? Relationships?
 I can understand being stressed if you think you are not doing well in school and have a lot of work. How are your grades now? Yes, that can be tough. When I had a lot of tests coming up and a lot to study for, I wrote down goals to study -- like I broke down the classes and made certain goals to study a bit in each class. And then if I did that, I could go out with friends or some reward like that.  For example, if you have 7 classes, you can make a chart for when you will study for each of those classes and then check them off as you accomplish it, maybe not all in one day, maybe break it up in reasonable bits. Then study according to your goal, if that makes sense. I remember after each class, I would take 15 minutes to review all my notes from class, that seems short, but really, it adds up and helped so much.
 Yes, stick to one subject at a time. For example, if you think 1/2 hour is good enough to study, then stick to that. When done, your done until the next time it is on your schedule.
 Procrastination never makes us feel good. If I keep putting something off, I then feel guilty. If I make a goal, and I reach it, I can put a reward. For example, if you study 3 subjects 1/2 hour each, you can go out for yogurt with a friend. So you reward yourself for sticking to that goal. Yes, I did. lol I'm really old now. This technique I use in all my life. Even house chores, I break it down into a schedule, put it in writing, then check off what I do. Then I feel good about my accomplishments.
 Definitely you need a break, so schedule them as rewards. You can even do 15 minutes in say 4 subjects, then take a walk, take a cup of tea, or call a friend, then back to the books.  Keep it as SIMPLE as possible, don't get bogged down. I used to think planning was TERRIBLE< but actually, it sets one FREE. You feel so much better and accomplished when you see how much you have done. It really is amazing. 
 HOw man classes do you have?
 many * That's a lot but it is totally doable. Here is a good example, If you plant seeds in a garden today, you have to weed it a bit tomorrow, the next day, the next day, you have to wait for rain, then weed some more, the harvest comes and YAY! You are happy. But if you lie on your bed, never planting, never weeding, you procrastinate, you get nothing.
 If you write your classes down and then write a reasonable time to study each one. Maybe 3 today, 3 tomorrow, then add rewards if you do that, maybe make a list of rewards, so you can pick and choose, then you check off when you do the subject.  Like a chore chart.  You are quite welcome! God bless have a great day!

problem: Problem: I have been procrastinating on my senior thesis, and the pending deadline is making me extremely nervous and on-edge.
solution: Solution: Hello there! How can I encourage you today? Hello? Anyone there? Ah! I remember my thesis, a lot of work. One thing for certain, I have a lot of pride over my accomplishment, it was well worth it. When is it due? I'm sure you will be able to finish it, sometimes we find ourselves in a slump and need some fresh air blown our way.  Do you have an advisor who is holding you accountable? Whenever I have a large project and lose motivation, I set my goals on paper, then break it down into smaller bites. For example, I will make sure I work one hour on certain days, or call a friend, I generate ideas to keep me on track. Yes, I sometimes feel guilty and then don't want to face the music, but actually the best thing to do is recognize you are NOT the first person she knows that got behind. So she is surely experienced with people who need some encouragement. She is the BEST person to go to, actually. It has always helped me. For example, you can break it down into 4 weeks, then each week write your goals -- maybe put call Advisor or go stop by every week, but I would put that first for the first week. Then as you check off items, you will see you are moving, even if at a snail's pace, you are moving, and that always encourages me. Sometimes I do not realize how much I AM doing, until I see it on paper. Paper doesn't lie, but my emotions sometimes cloud my thinking. Another idea is rewards, when you finish one goal, perhaps put a reward for yourself,  a yogurt with sprinkles or something like that You sound like me! I had to learn that I need to strive for EXCELLENCE, not perfection. Perfection will drain us. Do the best I can, leave the rest to God.  That is why a time line is good. For example, you make a goal that you will work on your reference and citation page for one hour, after that, you are DONE, If you have time at the end, you can revisit it. The hour is my suggestion, you make your own. lol THAT way, you don't get caught going on and on for 6 hours to make it perfect. One hour is reasonable.  I do this with EVERYTHING in life because I tend to go on and on too focused and lose track of everything. lol For example, I clean each room for 15 minutes a week. If it needs more, I do more, but I set the timer and you would be surprised how well that works, otherwise, I will spend all my time perfecting one room and the rest is a mess. Also, your Advisor will know tips to help you too. She has advised a lot of people, her objectivity and experience can give get RIGHT to the heart of any problem, quickly too. Tough advisors are TOUGH. lol But You sound intelligent and you obviously WANT to do this, it is a goal of yours, I'm sure you can take it!  It is only one more month of your life. If you buckle down, it will be over and done with before you know it. And I assure you, you will look back in pride at your accomplishments! My Graduation Day was amazing.  This is what life is about, working NOW for rewards later. It's like a garden, you sow, you weed, you wait for rain and weed some more. You keep waiting and weeding, then later harvest come. It takes time to work a little each day, then time passes whether you lay on your bed or whether you are in the garden working. If you lay on your bed, you get nothing, if you work a little every day, in time, you reap rewards.  Not much in life is easy or free, if we keep working little by little, as time passes, you real a lot of rewards, in fact, you will reap rewards of finishing this thesis for YEARS even decades. It is a great goal and a worthy one to keep at.  I commend you for doing the thesis and I also know it can get weary as time passes, but with some goals on paper a visit to the ADVISOR (hee hee) will set you up right for continued success.  You are very welcome. Have a blessed evening!!

problem: Problem: I am scared to open myself up to others such as men because I do not want my heart to be broken but it is also due to my insecurities about my looks and weight.  there is one guy who likes me that live in france but I am not sure if I should pursue him or not.
solution:
Solution: Good evening, how are you feeling today?  I am sorry, I gather life is not going well for you right now? Would you like to talk about it?  I am more than happy to listen and to help if I can. I do know how bad things can get at this time of year.  Let's take things one at a time .. have you lost your job recently?  Yes, I can understand that jobs are very hard to come by right now 
 Well that is one positive thing. Can you tell me a little about the guy you are afraid to open up to?  Well, I would recommend not taking things too quickly but relationships online CAN work - I met my fiance of ten years online.  But we did take it very slowly and talked for a year before we met in person.  Well, if he is reliable then he will be happy to wait till you are ready to meet. Where do you live, do you mind me asking?  Ah well definitely do not contemplate meeting him whilst the pandemic is on! But it might be  good excuse to put things off for a bit, do you think?  I do think that it might be a while before travel in Europe fully opens up again. Things are not good here.  I am in the UK. The pandemic is very bad here at the moment.  Two more! It's very scary and I don't recommend coming either here or continental Europe right now.  So, I hear you saying that you are a bit wary of the relationship and do not know if it can work in the real world?  Turkish people are lovely and welcoming - you should not worry about that :). But don't let yourself be pushed into anything you don't feel ready for  Yes I know a few Turkish people. They're very nice people, don't listen to any stereotypes!  I do understand how trying new things can be very difficult - this is something that I struggle with myself. But - if you don't take a chance, how can you know what might have happened?  I really hope that I have been able to reassure you a little bit and help you to try to think things through. I wish you a very happy holiday season!  It's Christmas Day here now but you too!  Can you hit quit and take the survey? :)

problem: Problem: I had to throw out my 13 year old sister.
solution: Solution: Hello, how are you at the moment? My name is Jo  I am not so bad. Is there anything you'd like to talk to me about today?  I am sorry to hear that. What precipitated that, had you been having problems for a while?  Ah, so you feel as though your mother could and should have helped and you were put into an impossible position you were not prepared for?  I can sympathise with you having siblings with extreme mental health problems - I have been there too and I know how difficult it is.  Mentally ill people can unfortunately sometimes be manipulative, though they do not mean it. Have you had any contact with her since?  That sounds very toxic. Is it possible to persuade her to seek medical help? I realise she might be reluctant to  Ah yes, it is a terrible time at the moment isn't it? I think a lot of people are not getting the medical help that they need because of the virus  Please do not beat yourself up over this - it does sound as though you have done absolutely everything you could to help.  I can tell that you feel really bad about this just from your  tone of voice. Please remember that you can't fix everything in the world.  Socialising can be hard for people with mental health problems. It might have been best if you did not press her too hard to do that though I know you did not realise.  Does she suffer from depression also? That might account for her trying to shut herself away  I understand that it can be very difficult to make people take medication if they refuse to recognise that they have a problem.  Unfortunately that is not likely to be possible. All you can do is be kind to yourself and know that you really did try to help her  I hope that I have been able to help a little. I really appreciate that you felt that you could open up to me  You're welcome. Have a lovely festive season! I feel that all will be better in the coming year.  You need to press quit from your end and take the survey :)

Ah - so I hear you saying you are tempted to be unfaithful to your marriage vows?  Well I must say that as a woman I would not allow it either ;)  It does sound like it. At least you recognise that you are not behaving well, which is the first step on the road to making things better.  Perhaps you could consider individual counselling to overcome your own problems before you think of couples' therapy?  Porn can be helpful for a relationship but it can also be damaging.  Well, perhaps it would be better for you to learn that you can't just do that even though you want to :)  I am forty five, fat and married :). I do recommend talking to someone though.  I am glad you were able to confide a little in me and hope it is the first step on the road to a happier marriage. I do recommend not giving into your urges and remembering how much you love your wife. I wish you all the best for the future and have a lovely Christmas!  Yes! problem: Problem: My friend created a separate chat for planning hangouts and did not include me.
solution: Solution: Hello there, how are you? I'm very sorry to hear that, did something not go as planned recently? I see. So when she did this, it gave you the feeling of almost being replaced or abandoned by your own social circle? It's definitely frustrating to feel that your support system could possibly become a source of stress and competition anxiety. Especially since it's where we're supposed to feel safe and unjudged. It sounds that you're a person who really does care about keeping the relationships they've invested in healthy and open. That care level can definitely cause natural anxiousness in situations like this, when the place you stand with them and what they're thinking suddenly feels uncertain. Right, and there are endless possibilites the mind can create outside of ideal. But funnily enough, the imagination of an idealist that lets them visualize great things can also create equally strong fears before getting answers. And thankfully those fears can be addressed outside of the head where they're made. Have you tried reaching out to these friends  yourself and initiating your own plan with them since this group chat? Right, it can seem a bit confusing since you naturally would expect to feel comfortable with so much between each other already. On the contrary, I think you might not be allowing yourself to ask enough! Sometimes, the people who are closest to us can actually become even more anxious about how something might affect your feelings. It could be the case with him too Some people express themselves best through their actions. Have you tried suggesting a meeting for something you'd usually do to see if they're willing to hang out just as always?

problem: Problem: Remote working is unfavorable
solution: Solution: Thank you for reaching out. Tell me more about it.  yeah I agree. This pandemic has really been weighing on us. As it pertains to work, you feel like the lacking of personal interaction has distanced yourself and colleagues and you feel like there is an increasingly large barrier given the physical constraint?  Can you tell me more about your work responsibilities - is it of a customer service nature? It would help me understand your situation better. I can relate to words vs. the combination of facial expression, body language, etc. The single channel of communication has stripped a lot of meaning and value and has made performance a lot more difficult. The transition is challenging and the uncertainty of the future also adds to the stress. Thank you for sharing that. I have a better understanding now.What you feel is very valid, and I am sure it is shared among a lot of people this year.  I am somewhat familiar with technical leadership. It requires a lot of mentoring and a level of comprehension of what others are doing.  My current work is in the finance section. Prior to pandemic, the touch base with colleagues are rather pleasant. Now the workload has decreased and we are rigidly arranging for meetings in 30 minute time slots. It is challenging in a sense that it is harder to fill the gap.  yeah it is a classroom for us to learn to adapt to the new normal. I understand the removal of everyone being the same room and chat tools don't convey the meaning 100 percent.  I would personally suggest more happy hours, in case you haven't already done so. Holiday care packages would also be a good common ground for folks to gather around over something that is not work. Yeah maybe also virtual meditation sessions can help concentration mind and body. It doesn't have to be hobbies of our own, but doing it as a team virtually can bring people together and boost morale.  That is good to hear. I am aware that the other team in my company all read a book called How to Be Antiracist. It can serve as both learning and bonding purposes.  I am glad that I can be of help. Thank you again for reaching out. Hope you adjust better to the changing norm next year and happy holidays.

problem: Problem: I am afraid that I will be out of work after the Christmas vacation. I work for a small company and they were counting on the new stimulus funding.
solution:
Solution: Hello! How are you today? You are feeling anxious about the future?
 Ok. You are making some assumptions on information you have about your company. Remember that you may not know the whole story.  I, too, have made assumptions that affection my outlook and caused anxiety.
 My assumptions were often wrong.  Ok. Have you thought about a plan? When you tell your family, it may help to state your planned actions. This may help with feelings of uncertainty, both theirs and yours.
 When I have been in a similar situation, I started reaching out to my network of friends and coworkers before I was let go. I know. This is the worst time of year for this news. Surprisingly, it happens very often. Having 2 months of savings is FANTASTIC! More than most people.  Do you anticipate any roadblocks to finding new employment in your industry?
 I understand your feelings. The holidays are a joyous time. No place for uncertainty. Do you think that outlining a plan of action, and sharing that with your family will help turn this around a bit? Perhaps, think about as looking forward to a better opportunity in your future? The stimulus has helped a lot of people get through this tough time. Sounds like you will feel much more secure knowing that you will have some income, and not have to use your savings that you worked so hard for. It's a wonderful thing to love your job. I love mine, as well, and would feel bad if it were put at risk. Your hard work and savings will get you through, no matter what happens or the gods decree. You have demonstrated that you can take care of yourself and your family. I can say that many friends of mine have found new jobs, most have left their old ones willingly for new opportunities. There are out there. Consider making your plan of action, regardless of what happens with the stimulus. THis is an unprecedented time. There may be ways to...use it to your advantage.
 You, too. Thank you, and take care :-)

problem: Problem: I have been overloaded with school work recently. I failed my first exam earlier this week and I am stressed and anxious about my exams later in the week.
solution:
Solution: Why have you been feeling stressed and anxious? 
 I'm sure you tried your best on that test, as long as you study hard I believe you can ace those next 2 exams! I've heard that meditation can help with stress and focus, maybe you could try meditating for a bit before you study? Meditation is essentially focussing on breathing, you could start by closing your eyes and slowly breathe in an out. From what you're saying to me, I feel that you don't believe in yourself very much.
 I've struggled with the same thing before, whenever I doubt myself I look back at all i've accomplished and look at myself in the mirror and tell myself that I can do it. It has worked well for me. problem: Problem: I've been really struggling lately with how much everything has changed during the pandemic. the holidays don't feel the same
solution: Solution: Hello, how are you feeling this evening? Can you explain to me more in depth what events are making you feel this way? I understand exactly how you feel since I am also unable to go fly out to see my family this Christmas. It sounds like you are very overwhelmed with the amount of work you have and having no break, correct? When I start to feel alone and missing my family or friends, I usually like the plan a skype or group facetime session right after I get off of work. There are online resources to have some fun with friends too--many blogs suggest hosting a group game night or a shared movie night. I am sure with a bit of trial and error, hosting a movie or game night would be a breeze for you too! Having this winter sadness, especially around holiday times, may be a sign of seasonal depression.  I have had seasonal depression in the past, and going on nature hikes and bike rides has helped me a lot. Maybe spending less time inside your home and grabbing some fresh air can relieve some of that anxiety and stress. Research shows that physical activity greatly reduces stress! It sounds like going out more would be very beneficial to you!

problem: Problem: I am recently divorced. My ex-husband has moved in with his new, much younger girlfriend and they are discussing marriage. Although I am happy the marriage is over, I'm depressed because I have not had any romantic offers while he has moved on with no problem.
solution:
Solution: Hello, my name is Jonathan. May I ask who I am speaking to today?
 Hi Keri. How are you today? Oh no. I'm sorry to hear that. What do you think would be the cause of you feeling down lately? Oh Keri, that must feel awful. Was it a recent separation between you two? Yeah I understand what you're going through. I was in a similar position not too long ago. I had a hard time wrapping my head around how fast my ex could move on from what we had. How does it make you feel that he's trying to start a new relationship so soon after yours? That must feel really isolating. But working on yourself and becoming a better you is the only way to move on in a healthy manner. I think you're doing the right thing in waiting and learning to love yourself before you can open up and love another.  I might not understand that particular aspect, but self worth is still self worth no matter the context. I'd say try not to pay any mind to what he's up to. The grass always looks greener on the other side of the fence, but if you just focus on watering your grass (making yourself happy) then you'll have a much more fulfilling life.  Oh absolutely Keri. Thanks for opening up and sharing your experience and feelings with me for just a few minutes. It was great to talk to you.  Happy Holidays Keri. Keep your head up!

problem: Problem: One of my classes is extremely difficult and my professor is not responsive.
solution: Solution: Hi there, how is this season treating you?  Well let's be grateful for small mercies :). How are you feeling in yourself though? Is there anything you'd like to talk about?  Ah I am sorry to hear that. Please try not to worry too much as it's a common worry to have. Do you want to tell me the details?  So you are feeling as though you are in the wrong place? Do you feel as though you might fail your class completely?  But do you really think that you would have been admitted to the class if you were not up to the standard? Do you think that maybe most of your classmates are secretly feeling the same?  This sounds like it might be a self esteem issue and not about your grades. I have felt this sort of thing myself and I do know how awful it is to be so hard on yourself.  Have you thought about seeing a therapist? Does your school have any free therapy programmes you could use?  A far as I am aware there are charitable organisations which can arrange a few free therapy session for you. Perhaps you could talk to your doctor about it?  I have had free therapy sessions before and I found them very helpful  It would help you work on your self confidence and you might find that you are not doing as badly in school as you think you are.  Then I think it is probably just a general self esteem issue and nothing academic!  Anyway it's been really nice to talk to you and I hope that everything goes your way  You're most welcome, have a lovely Holiday season.

problem: Problem: Finals week has pushed me to my limits and is causing me to be very stressed and moody.  Many people in my family are noticing my personality being like a stir-crazy animal.
solution:
Solution: Hello, don't worry, I am here to help. Could you tell me what is going on?
 I can definetely imagine how stressful the last week of school can be, especially taking 5 courses instead of 4.
 However, don't let this situation scare you or ruin  your holidays. There are ways to cope with said stress.
 First of all, do you have some academic counselor you can talk to? Help you organize your ideas or classwork? Can you refer to professors or fellow classmates for help?
 Are you confident in your abilities to succeed in those classes or you think you might lack the materials or knowledge? Or perhaps time?
 It's okto be moody given the circumstances and the stress you are going through, and I think that you should attemp to complete all the assignments even if you don't get a 100% on them.
 That will show the professors that you are responsible and care about the subject or perhaps your major.
 Accomplishing to submit everything will also make you feel good with yourself!
 It's important than you take your time.
 I understand that college can be financially demanding.
 You need to think that you will have a secure job once you graduate, and every debt will be eventually paid off even if Biden doesn't forgive it.
 Try to remain optimistic and shake away the anxiety, it won't do you
 any good. Do you feel better after talking about all of this?
 Not at all, I think what you are experiencing is completely normal, and you just have to cope with it in the most optimistic way possible. Maybe getting your assignments done in time will be helpful for your anxiety. After that, you will have tons of time to spend with friends, family, or simply leisure time to do what you enjoy.
 It is a pleasure to help : )

problem: Problem: Car accident led to traumatic brain injury and PTSD having nightmares 2x a week.
solution:
Solution: Hello, I'm so sorry to hear that. That sounds like an awful lot to go through in a few years time, which now can feel like the time passes so quickly. 

 Have you tried to talk to your therapist through video chat or is that something they offer?
 That's great that they can offer that, I know it's very difficult to get regular care at the moment with the pandemic. 
 Do you have any family or friends close by or something that you can talk to if you feel like you need some extra support? I am sorry to hear that, people are very quick to judge so it's very unfortunate that you were treated that way.  
 Wow, I can't imagine what the car must have looked like then for such a comment to be made. I'm glad that you here and despite going through that trauma that you are still going.
  A women fell asleep at the wheel in 2013 and hit me going through an intersection and totaled by car as well, but I had only had a concussion and pain I had to go to physical therapy for a short time, so I can't imagine how you must have felt.
 I'm sorry that you didn't get the support you needed after your accidents because it's hard enough to go through the pain and trauma (mental and physical) to begin with and the support is much needed.
 You are 100% correct. Have you looked into any support groups at all or tried to connect with anyone with similar experiences through social media?  Gotcha! Well I'm glad I was able to connect with you this evening because sometimes it helps just to chat and have someone listen :-)  I hope that for 2021 things can somewhat go back to normal so the routines can get back to what they were and that this next year is your best year yet. You have already been through so much to be in your 20's.

problem: Problem: I have to repeat one of my classes over winter break, but I have plans with family. I will lose my scholarship if i dont pass
solution: Solution: Hi, are you having a good day at the moment?  Is there a general problem that you would like to talk about? I am more than happy to listen.  I am sorry to hear that but try not to panic, just failing one class is not the end of the world. How do you feel about retaking it?  Ah so you feel that this is going to be severely disruptive to your plans for this winter break?  Is it possible for you to get any sort of private tutoring which might help you?  Ah .. in that case is it possible to talk to your doctor? They might be able to get a special allowance for you given your personal circumstances  I think that it would be a really good idea if you talked to them about it. They will probably be a lot more understanding than you might think  If they love you, and I am sure that your family do, then they will accept what has happened without criticism  Well, do you have any siblings that you are close to and that you could tell first?  It is good to hear you have a twin. Are you very close?  Well I think that it might be a very good idea if she could approach the rest of your family and maybe even your therapist on your behalf?  Well, your therapist is not, in my mind, as important as  your family. But I think that both will understand!

problem: Problem: My girl decided to break up with me by text, instead of in person.  It was a breakup that other friends also heard about and asked me about not much later in the breakup process.
solution: Solution: How is your day going today? Do you have anything on your mind?  I am sorry to hear that - so life is not great at the moment? Would you like to tell me more?  I understand. I know how hard it can be to open up about what is worrying you. I've been in that position too.  Oh I am so sorry! That is a really unpleasant thing to do to someone, especially at this time of year.  Is there anyone close to you that you can talk to about this? Friends?  Yes it is a very cowardly thing to do. I am quite disgusted that she did not have the courage to talk to you face to face too. You have every right to feel angry.  Unfortunately there are people out there who are not true friends and who just want something to talk about. I have experienced that myself.  It really is not is it! I can tell how upset you feel just from talking to you, and also that the method of the break up is  really sore point.  It could be that you are better off without her? If she has such bad manners then I think that you cn do better.  Yes I do. I would not personally do that to someone even if I was unhappy in  relationship.  Yes I have been dumped. We had been together for eight years and he left me for another woman.  I know how you are feeling but I think that you need to get professional help to move on. Are you able to go to therapy?  Well, I think it could be really beneficial to let your anger out  That would be an absolutely terrible thing to do. Do you really think that your friend would do a t hing like that to you?  Do you think that perhaps you should talk to him before anything happens? You do not want to ruin your friendship by having him do that  Well you do not want to let that situation escalate any further. I hope I have been able to be of some help to you and I urge you to look for professional therapy if you can. All the best to you for Christmas and the year 2021!  Yes you really should. All the best and thanks for talking.

problem: Problem: Fear of losing my job
solution: Solution: Hey, how are you doing today? Anything going on? I know actually I've had a rough day, but would love to hear about yours. That's okay, just wanted to reach out and see how you are! Oh no, I am so sorry to hear that.  So it sounds a bit like you are entering a period of uncertainty and are going to be struggling :( Well i know it is difficult, but just wanted to share that I am here for you in these hard times.  And you're so smart that even if you lose this job you will find another one :) Actually currently I am unemployed too actually, although I have a new opportunity starting next month.  So I know it can be rough  Well have you thought of any next steps to take?  From what I have seen, it is easier to start looking for a new job before you need to leave the old one.  Maybe you could start job searching sooner rather than later?  I might have some contacts that can help Awesome! Let me know if there is anything else I can do to help you in these tough times.  It can be useful to take some time to relax too :) Maybe eat a favorite food or talk with a friend or go on a long walk to destress :) Awesome, meditation can always help make complex problems feel a bit simpler.  And it is okay to feel upset right now, as long as you realize that things will get better, and that you have lots of people supporting you! Anything else i can help you with? Or are you going to go meditate now? You're welcome! Hope you have a wonderful week :)  Always good to chat Of course! Yup, again, it is always great to reach out since other people might be going through the same struggles!  I was feeling upset until I messaged you and now I feel happier! Bye! You're welcome!

problem: Problem: I am very scare of this pandemic call COVID-19
solution:
Solution: Hi! How are you tonight? Glad to hear that! Is there some way I can encourage you? :D What is the worst part of it for you? Can you identify that? I'll be honest, my husband and I don't even see anyone dying.  Half your neighbors died? So do you think you can identify the most difficult problem you have? Maybe we can look at that and possible find better ways to cope? I can understand feeling depressed. I think that can be debilitating at times, however there are ways to cope and help you get out of it.  I used to struggle a lot with depression, but not much anymore. I learned a lot of coping strategies. I can share a few of those with you if you want.  One of the best ways is to take a walk. Get outside, get fresh air. Look at the sky and the clouds and the trees and the grass. This will not only physically refresh you but help your health as well.
 As for the pandemic, if you know no one who has died, I wouldn't worry about it. The CDC has no reported deaths of anyone healthy. People who are unhealthy die, not the healthy, and people who are sick ALREADY are the ones who die. If you are relatively healthy, then you are good to go. Do things to protect your health. What are you eating? What are you drinking? Are you talking to friends and getting social life? Are you getting fresh air? Thinking good thoughts?  Or are you living in fear when you are not going to a lot of funerals.  It is well documented that our immune system is affected by our mental state, so it is important that you care for your health. Focusing on the negativity of the pandemic will bring you down. Focusing on being healthy and taking care of your mind, soul, spirit and body will help build up your immunity and make you strong. I can understand an ambulance sound is hard to hear, but even that can be turned around. You can pray for the person, then switch your mind off. If you focus on the negative, you will stay negative. If you do what you can (pray) then there is nothing else to do. Focusing on the negative will depress you.  One thing I did to help with depression is keep a checklist of things to do when I felt down:  call a friend, call a loved one to encourage THEM, go for a walk, eat fruits and veggies, read a book, go for a bike ride, etc.  Things like that, then I chose to do those things despite how I felt. Doing those things helped my mood TREMENDOUSLY>  Feelings follow thoughts. If you think negative thoughts, you will feel negative. If you think positive thoughts, you will feel positive. Sometimes this takes time, but it works.  Just because you feel sad doesn't mean you should just do nothing, a person can TALK their way out of sadness and choose to do something different.  I am glad you were able to talk about how this is affecting you. I think many people are affected. And I encourage you to really do things you like and enjoy to keep your mood better. If you feel down, talk about it, pray about it but do NOT dwell on it, because that will bring you down. Sometimes we get in a funk, when we do, we can pull ourselves out, I do suggest you write a list of things to do and put on the frige. Thank you, how very sweet!  I do thank you for sharing your life with me. I'm an older person and this has affected me too.  Life is full of ups and downs, so I've been through some rough times. You can do this! :D I had one more thought about when the ambulance comes by and you get upset. Pray for the person, pray for the workers. They are the ones who CAN do something about the sick people. You cannot. You didn't become an ambulance worker. I am not an ambulance worker, I cannot help them either, but I can pray God can help them do their job. Then I let it go.  I cannot worry about what is not my job. I have a home and family to care for and pets and neighbors.  So this is what I can do, I cannot fix the sick so the ambulance workers do their job, I do mine. When I try to do their job and worry all about them and the sick people, it's not my job and there will be no peace doing the wrong job. If that makes sense.  If that is all, then you simply finish the hit. I am sure you will do just fine!   You are very welcome! Goodbye now and God bless you!

problem: Problem: the event that put in this mood was a big gathering of people of all sorts and kinds
solution: Solution: Hello there, how is life for you right now?  Well, that sounds vaguely positive but is there something you'd like to talk specifically about?  Have you been having some problems with your friends lately? This can be a very stressful time of year, I know.  So you are feeling worried deep down about something right now? Would you like to tell me more about ti?  Do you think that perhaps you feel numb to things that are going on even though you should be worried about them?  I see - that is interesting, I have never heard of anything like that before. Do you think that there might be some sort of physical problem going on?  Well, erm, thank you and a very Merry Christmas to you too. Yes fifteen minutes :D. Have you thought of making a list of goals for the New Year to motivate yourself?  I smoke too much too. It costs a lot and it's really bad for my health. I think I am gonna try and quit - again, sigh - in January too  Maybe try saving the money you save on cigarettes for a few months and then treat yourself to something really nice?  Nearly ten pounds a pack here (UK). I am gonna try and save up for a new handbag!  Everything is cheaper there than here :D. Do you have any fun plans for Christmas Day?  It will be nice to have a couple of stress free days ... assuming that they are stress free!  I hope you have a really nice Christmas and New Year too. Let's face it, hopefully 2021 cannot be worse than 2020 (touch wood)  Anyway thank you for talking and I hope you feel a little better.  Hit the button and take the survey ;). I can't end it from my side

problem: Problem: I am in a crisis over my employer not having enough money to pay me.  It is really causing me to be fearful.
solution: Solution: When did this fear start? It sounds like your childhood trauma and the economy is the cause for you not being confident in your job situation. Is this correct? Do you have anyone you can talk to about this? A relative or a close peer at your job? You know, I once felt the same you are feeling and had the same idea that everyone had their own problems, but I took the courage to seek for help and found out that the people who really care about me will always want to help me. There are many counselors who specialize in this field of job security and especially during this pandemic and the falling economy, they are great support systems. If you want other suggestions, meditation is something that is extremely overlooked and will help you before you even take the big leap to get support from a counselor or relative. Just taking deep breaths in a quiet area is a great way to clear your head and keep optimistic. Since a lot of this stress is being caused by your childhood trauma, it seems like there is something that connects that job to your trauma and if it cant be disconnected, it seems like you should find another job.  And I understand that is not the easiest in these times but I believe you can do it! Do you think those jobs would help you disconnect your childhood trauma and work life?  Just giving it a try is what starts every journey and I am proud of you for taking that leap! No problem I hope all goes well for you and I hope you stay safe. Goodbye!

Do you feel that this has knocked your self confidence and affected your family life at all?  I totally understand. I have had my hours cut down as well and it's really been worrying me. January should hopefully bring better things to the world I think. I am really looking forward to it, I think it will be good.  Will you be getting a vaccine for Covid? I am really hopeful bout that  That sounds like a good idea. It's been really nice talking, I wish you all the best for 2021!  Take care and goodbye :)  You need to quit first .. I can't :)  you need to press quit and take the survey  Neither of us will be paid if you don't press the quit and take survey button.

problem: Problem: Everyone breaks up with me. They all think I'm weird, and I always screw myself.

That is a defeatist way to talk! Just because a couple of relationships fail does not mean that you will never be able to find happiness.  I have been in that position too. It's horrible to feel that you are losing your self respect but I suspect that we've all done it at some point. Have you considered getting some counselling?  I hear  you saying that they are not really effective, is that true?  Okay .. I hope you reported him!!  I understand that as well .. I am on medication for it. A dog is a wonderful thing to have! Do you feel that it has helped you?  Dogs are very very loyal. They never cheat on you or walk out on you!  I think you are probably not anywhere near as bad as you think you are you know :). Anyway I wish you all the very best for the New Year and hope that things pick up for you soon! take care!  (you need to quit first and take the survey .. I can't :))

problem: Problem: I don't like any of my friends. In fact, I don't think I like anyone.

Ah yes, this has been especially obvious during the pandemic hasn't it? Too many people not following the social distancing rules  Do you feel that the pandemic has made you feel worse? Or have you felt like this for a long time?  Well, it is a pretty significant issue this year :). Re obesity, have you considered doing something to raise awareness?  So you feel as though there is no bright side - that everything is just artificial and superficial? I know plenty of people who spend too much of their life working every hour and it leaves them no time to appreciate their money!  People like that are irritating, certainly. I am not sure what the solution is, other than to ignore them.  Well, the fact that you can reflect on it indicates to me that you are probably not guilty. Most of those who do this are totally unaware.  It has been really nice chatting to you and I hope that things go your way in 2021. You seem like  good person :)  you too :)  you need to finish from your end .. I can't :)

problem: Problem: My school is extremely rigorous and I'm experiencing difficulty with anxiety
solution:
Solution: Hello. Academic work can be overwhelming at times. I am sure that with the right strategies you will overcome any obstacles, though.
 Could you tell me what the issue is in particular?
 It is perfectly fine to feel stressful whenever an important assessment is coming.
 Make sure that you try to be as prepared as you can. When you feel capable of doing well on said exams, you will feel a lot less pressure.
 Do you have an academic councelor you can talk to?
 Well at least is something. I am sure talking to someone who might be able to guide you academically will be a significant relief.

 When I was at college, I usually aimed at 2 hours of studying everyday (+ homework) and I also aimed to have at least 2 hours of leisure time.
 I honestly didn't eat very healthy. If you live with your parents, I think a proper nutrition is easier. I usually slept around 7 hours each night. I picked most of my classes on the afternoon, worked out in the mornings.
 I would suggest talking to the professor or an academic advisor to explore strategies that could help you improve
 Of course, it is normal to feel upset. However, you should not blame yourself. No one is perfect.
 I am glad it does :D!
 Anything else I can help you with today?
 You are very welcome!

problem: Problem: My boyfriend cheated on me and I found out 6 months later at work from a customer. I was so embarrassed. I did not eat for days.
solution:
Solution: Cheating on you? How do you know that your partner is cheating on you? Did he tell you that he is? I am sorry if your partner is cheating. So, your partner denies the charge of cheating? Are you and your partner married?
 How long have you been in a relationship with your man? So, 2 years should be long enough to know if your partner has been cheating. Are you someone who trusts people? I think that most men would fess up about it. Does he show affection to you? If he is adamant about loving you, then, it may be false allegations. I have had coworkers lie and be jealous that I have a good relationship with my partner. Ash your partner if he loves you enough to propose marriage. If he says no, then ask him why. Yes, workers can be a real problem and can make up stories about people. Slander in the work place happens. Unfortunately, lies and rumors are just that. Sure, I understand. Yes, the workplace is not like home life.   Yes, trust matters. I would see if he wants to spend time doing things like volunteering after work.  If he says yes, or is excited, that is a good sign that he wants to be with you....even after work. Find things that he has in common or energize the relationship. Yes, ask him if he wants to learn to swing dance or take skiing lessons or volunteer for Habitat for Humanity. You have done your part, but if he wants to show you affection on a regular basis, that is a good sign. How old are the both of you? Are you intimate with your partner, on a regular basis? Spicing up the live life can also help to energize hings. I mean, the love life.  Te lack in the last few months could be a physical issue or stress related....for him. Does he mention a lot of stress at the job or is he in college? 22 is young. You are both relatively young. I feel that there is plenty to learn about each other. How do you all generally communicate? Through text? Which do you and your man like to communicate? Well, you and your man are under a lot of stress, so keep that in mind. The study may be making him withdraw a lot. I would ask his fellow students, if you know any of them if they think he really loves you. I would be subtle about that tactic.   If you haven't met any of his school mates. I wouldn't pursue that option.  Have you met any of his class mates? Are you and him directly off campuses in housing? You both attend the same college, correct? Where do you work? Have you seen the customer who said that your partner was cheating? Seen the customer before? Was it a man or woman who dropped the shocking news? I feel that the customer may have a case of mistaken identity indeed. Sounds like drunk slander talk.  I would let things go for awhile and follow up later.

problem: Problem: I just lost my job of seven years and am anxious about finding a new one during the holidays in a pandemic.

 You lost your job? thats a tough situation. Is it due to covid? I know its tough especially with the holidays and all. You have so many great skills and are such a hard worker I dont think you will have a problem at all finding something different.  I remember a time I lost my job and felt my whole world crumbling but then I realized when one door closes another door opens. when those doors close it seems that its usually for the best because it opens the path for something bigger and greater for you. Is waiting until next semester something your willing to do? That would give you time to reflect on yourself and your future and figure out what you want to do as a career. I could give you a list of other online opportunities to make money if you would be interested. your welcome. There are a lot of online options out there. That may be easier for you at the time being without a car. Do you have a support system of family or friends around here?

problem: Problem: no specific event to describe
solution:
Solution: Hello. What seems to be the issue?
 You said you generally don't trust family or people in general?
 Just people who are close to you?
 I have had a hard time trusting strangers, but that is not a big problem. I used to be the same way, but I learned about how to make and keep close friends. I joined volunteer groups to help others.  I made friends with like-minded people who volunteered to make a difference. Groups like Habitat for Humanity or UNICEF will help you to build long-lasting friendships. It just takes finding the right volunteer groups and being willing to be pro-active. You can do it. There is a group called, "Harry House" that provides support to those with ADHD and anxiety. Surely. Is there anything else you need help with? No, Habitat fir Humanity has car pools.  They are a good group to help you build meaningful relationships. I used to do a hour at a time; maybe one or twice a week. Would you be interested in something like HFH? Yes, you can sign up online to join a project. Yes, you can volunteer locally; HFH is nationwide. Any other questions? I am glad to assist. I have done volunteer work; people want to be friends with those who care and know how to use a nail and hammer. :) It may also help to contribute some money to keep the organization going.  I felt great after making friends and building homes for low income people.

problem: Problem: worried about losing my job
solution:

I also once had to take care of my sick grandmother after work and had a tough time explaining it to my boss.  Have you offered to stay later to make up the work?  Maybe your boss can compromise with you. It's worth a shot! You sound like you care about this job and that is a valuable asset in a an employee.  I understand. Is there a coworker or mentor that maybe you can talk to?  That's a great idea! Also review your employee handbook and see if there are things you can do to negotiate with HR or your boss in regards to your hours.  Always best to come prepared :) That's great! I am happy I could help you during such a difficult time. How long have you been at the job?  I understand. Being new at a job can have its difficulties.  From speaking with you, it seems like you are caring and hardworking.  I hope your boss can understand you are facing a difficult time. If he has loved ones or family of his own, he surely will.  Is there anything else I can help you with today?

problem: Problem: Quarantine keeps going on and on.
solution:
Solution: I can definetely understand why. During this pandemic we have been more isolated than ever
 It's not easy
 It is more than reasonable to be frustrated with regards to that. I myself have not been able to visit my ill mother. She lives in another country, so it's especially difficult.
 Exactly, the experience feels like it lacks the main connection we share with our loved ones. It is totally normal to want to be face to face instead.
 I agree with you, what used to be super-exciting activities now have a much more monotonous feeling. However, it's not the end of the world. Thankfully, researchers have just came up with a vaccine prototype I heard.
 I know it's not easy, but try to think of this whole situation of a challenge that you are overcoming. What doesn't kill you only makes you stronger. You will come out of this ready for any hardships that life might throw at you.
 It will hopefully be over sooner than we think.
 Just try to keep a positive attitude, focus on the things you like, and time will fly.

problem: Problem: The person ghosted me after we had an argument and I am really upset about it.
solution: Solution: Hello! How are you doing today? I'm doing well, thank you! I'm so sorry to hear that. What's going on that's making you feel that way? That's terrible. I would really like to help you find a solution to this problem, but it appears as though you may not be active anymore. I'm going to wait a few more minute for you to respond before cancelling the chat. In the event that I don't hear back from you, I wish you the best!

problem: Problem: I am currently studying for an exam that I need to do for work.
solution:
Solution: Hello! How can I help you today? It's normal to feel nervous whenever we have an important assessment coming.
 I myself would always be really anxious whenever I had any finals back in college.
 I would suggest that you study as much as you can. The more prepared you are for that test, the more manageable you will find it and the less stressed you will feel. I understand. However, you need to be able to find some time dedicated to your school activities. You are the one who needs to decide how to insert it in your schedule.
 I agree, once you have your career set up you won't have to worry about working and studying anymore. You will be doing what you like for a good living. Think about the future.
 Just remember not to stress too much about it. It's just one test at the end of the day, you can do this!
 I know that I told you to try to fit school time into your schedule, but the same goes with leisure time for yourself. Find an activity that you enjoy and try to dedicate at least an hour a day to it, be it exercising, playing videogames, reading a book.
 Happens to all of us. I myself sometimes get too invested in work and the days go by without me realizing it, but it should definetely be a priority. Try to maximize your efficiency so you can do your work while having more time for other activities.
 That's absolutely great, make good use of them (^_^)
 Is there anything else I can help you with today? No worries, you too!

problem: Problem: I don't have motivation to do anything. Everything seems pointless.
solution:

 If you don't mind me asking, how old are you?

 It has been a pleasure! You too! (You have to hit Quit and fill the questionarie)

problem: Problem: I broke up with my ex partner and found out they cheated on me
solution:
Solution: Hello, how are you today
 I see. Sometimes that can happen when you look back on yourself.  What is making you angry about the past? I can personally relate to that myself. I have went through something similar like that 4 years ago. It can be very frustrating when it happens.   The easiest thing that I did in my situation was obtained a new hobby. I took my anger out on my ex by joining Crossfit and interacted with that community. It helped me take my mind of from my ex.   Crossfit may not be for everyone, but do you think a new hobby may help you? Have you taken one in recently? Painting is an excellent hobby. I can see that it's relaxing as well as help put your emotions into something physical.  It sounds like that you are doing great with your hobby. Have you try to interact with anyone else, such as an art community or your friends on your feedback? Yea, I can see why that may make you feel alone in that aspect. I thought about that myself, but there are groups that can help you out. Strangers in fact. I went on Reddit to express my frustrations and it can help to just let out your anger. It can be, but seeing several posts in their groups, most offer advice or at least sympathy. It is kind of like what we are doing right now to be honest. Again, it is not for everyone, but it does offer a group to talk to during this pandemic lol.  Only if you think it will help. Do you think it will? No problem. I really hope that I was able to help you at least. I am still available if you want to discuss further. Like I said, I know how it feels because my ex hid from me 2 years that she was seeing someone else, so I can relate with you. Have a good day :)
